results.title: Glasshouse soils
results.creator_credit: Mary Beales, Jack Chambers and Central Office of Inofrmation Film
results.brief_description: Shows the need for regular sterilisation of glasshouse soils if plant diseases are to be avoided. The methods used at the Cheshunt Experimental and Research Station, England, are described.

results.title: Given a chance
results.brief_description: This is a video which focusses on the life experiences of refugee young people in australia. The video is divided into two sections: Section one explores the refugee experience from the perspective of 5 young who have resettled in Australia from the countries of El Salvador, Vietnam, Afghanistan, Cambodia and Eritrea. It is relevant to both workers and young people. Section two explores issues for service providers and contains interviews with experienced workers with refugee young people. The video can be used in education and training of both young people and professionals working with refugee young people. Includes video training notes.

results.title: Give us a go
results.creator_credit: Diane Charleson and Materials Production, Education Dept for Equal Opportunity Board
results.brief_description: An explanation of the functions of the Equal Opportunity Board as it relates to the disabled. Various examples of discrimination are shown together with re-enactments showing conciliation and Board hearings.

results.title: Give them a chance: forgotten refugees
results.brief_description: With an introduction by Duke Edinburgh, this film considers the plight of thousands of refugees who are still in camps in Europe, especially Greece. Many of them are without a country or relatives and pass their time in loneliness and misery in the squalor of the refugee camps. The United Nations Refugee Emergency Fund was set up for the purpose of helping these people. In Greece in the 1950’s, the Fund was able to assist the Greek Government in building homes and as a result many could hope for a better future.

results.title: Give him air
results.creator_credit: John Sharpies and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description: Asphyxia and the term “getting one’s air” are explained. Various situations in which a casualty may die for lack of air are discussed. These are: poisonous atmosphere, blocked air passage, coma, crushed chest, and stab wound. The life saving actions to be taken are explained in detail and the unpleasant aspects of the injuries leading to asphyxia are not concealed. Winner of various film competition prizes.

results.title: Girl's sports: on the right track
results.brief_description: Considers the limited opportunities available to women who want to compete in sporting events. Shows how these limitations are being replaced by new opportunities for women in a variety of competitive sports including track and field. Through a short history of track and field, with original archive footage of Babe Didrikson and Wilma Rudolf, the limitations that were available for women to compete in sporting events are shown. The experiences of three high-school girls - a cross-country runner, a shot putter and a broad jumper - shows the new opportunities available for girls today.
